abstract.p: Neural stem/progenitor cells (NSPCs) retain their ability to generate newborn neurons throughout life in the mammalian brain. Here, we describe how recently developed virus- and transgenesis-based techniques will help us (1) to understand the functional effects of neurogenesis in health and disease, (2) to design novel approaches to harness the potential for NSPC-associated endogenous repair, and (3) to induce the generation of neurons outside the main neurogenic niches in the adult brain.

Recently developed virus- and transgenesis-based techniques may help illuminate functions of neurogenesis, enable the use of neural precursor cells for endogenous repair, and induce neurogenesis outside the main niches.
